cyclone.name: KATE
cyclone.current_location: about 80 miles (130 km) southeast of San Salvador Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue northwestward this morning, then turn north-northwest and north, passing through the Bahamas and then lifting northward well offshore the Florida east coast toward the open western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: portions of the central and north-western Bahamas (not the U.S. mainland)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, then the western Atlantic east of the Florida and Georgia coasts
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: NEW PROVIDENCE BAHAMAS (nearest point listed in wind table)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty north-east winds late Monday through Tuesday could occasionally approach tropical-storm force (near 35 mph) along Florida’s Space Coast, including Port Canaveral.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor coastal run-up and rough surf (generally <3 ft above normal) expected along the Brevard County barrier beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain, well below 4-inch threshold.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents that may disrupt small-craft operations near the harbor entrance.
